place.name: WARLEGGAN
place.gazetteerText: WARLEGGON, a parish in Bodmin district, Cornwall; 3 miles N by W of Doublebois r. station, and 5½ ENE of Bodmin. Post town, Bodmin. Acres, 2,055. Real property, £1,453; of which £50 are in mines. Pop., 295. Houses, 64. The property is divided among a few. The living is a rectory in the diocese of Exeter. Value, £125.* Patron, G. W. F. Gregor, Esq. The church is good. (In 1870-72, John Marius Wilson's Imperial Gazetteer of England and Wales)
